name: Techinance
description: Cybersecurity certification overseen by college students from NYU and professors from UAA, awards 8+ volunteer hours. Sign Up: http://bit.ly/44sJwYK

name: Robotics Team
description: Design, build, and program robots for competitions like FIRST Robotics.

name: Research Project: Biodegradable Materials
description: Research and develop environmentally friendly materials for everyday products.

name: Digital Media Magazine
description: Create an online magazine showcasing student artwork, photography, and creative writing.

name: Model United Nations
description: Simulate UN committees to debate global issues and develop diplomatic skills.

name: Local History Documentary
description: Research and create a documentary about the history of your community.

name: DECA Competition
description: Compete in business simulations and case studies in various business fields.

name: Start a Small Business
description: Launch your own small business or online store while in high school.

name: Hackathon Participation
description: Join 24-48 hour coding competitions to build innovative software and hardware projects.

name: Develop a Mobile App
description: Create a mobile application that solves a problem in your school or community.

name: Organize a Charity Fundraiser
description: Plan and execute a fundraising event for a cause you care about.

name: Tutoring Program
description: Start a tutoring initiative for underprivileged students in your community.

name: Start a School Club
description: Found and lead a new club based on your interests or addressing a school need.

name: Science Fair Project
description: Conduct original research and present findings at local, regional, or national science fairs.

name: University Research Internship
description: Work alongside professors on current research projects at a local university.

name: Independent Research Project
description: Design and conduct your own research study on a topic you are passionate about.

name: DIY Arduino Weather Station
description: Build a weather-monitoring system using Arduino and report trends online.

name: Children's STEM Book Project
description: Illustrate and publish a children's book teaching STEM concepts.

name: Speech & Debate
description: Compete in a speech and debate team, focusing on current events.

name: Oral History Archive
description: Interview immigrant families and create a digital archive of their stories.

name: Youth Investing Club
description: Start a youth investing club and hold weekly mock stock trading sessions.

name: Teen Finance App
description: Develop a budgeting app tailored for teens and first-time earners.

name: Model Congress
description: Participate in a Model Congress event to draft and debate policy proposals.

name: We The People Team
description: Join a competitive civics team to analyze constitutional law cases.

name: Teen Voices Podcast
description: Start a local podcast discussing teen mental health and social change.

name: Multilingual News Blog
description: Create and maintain a bilingual blog on current world events for teens.

name: Medical Shadowing & Outreach
description: Shadow a local doctor and assist with organizing community health fairs.

name: Teen Health Channel
description: Develop a health education YouTube channel focusing on teen wellness.

name: Peer Wellness Program
description: Create a peer-to-peer mental health support network at school.

name: Eco Data Tracker Website
description: Lead a team to build a website that tracks local sustainability efforts.

name: Nonprofit Connect App
description: Launch a startup connecting nonprofits with student volunteers through an app.

name: School Startup Incubator
description: Start a startup incubator at your school supporting student business ideas.

name: Language Olympiad (International Linguistics)
description: Join a national or international language Olympiad or competition.

name: TEDxYouth Organizer
description: Organize a local TEDxYouth event featuring teen changemakers.

name: City Youth Advisory Council
description: Join a youth council that advises the city on teen-related issues.

name: Social Justice Podcast
description: Start a podcast discussing current social justice issues with student guests.

name: Competitive Math Team
description: Join a competitive math team and participate in contests like AMC and AIME.

name: Sustainable Garden Initiative
description: Build a community garden to promote sustainability and food justice.

name: Tech Ethics Blog
description: Write and publish a research-backed blog on tech ethics.

name: AP U.S. Government and Politics
description: Explore political institutions, policy-making, and civic participation in the U.S.

name: AI for Climate Project
description: Create a machine learning model that predicts climate patterns.

name: Youth Activism Zine
description: Create and distribute a zine on youth activism and civic engagement.

name: Bioethics Debate Team
description: Participate in a bioethics debate team exploring medical ethics.

name: Accessible Game Design
description: Design an accessible educational game for children with disabilities.

name: Environmental Policy Research
description: Conduct research on local environmental impact and present findings to city council.

name: Mental Health App
description: Create a mobile app to support mental health in teens.

name: Intel International Science and Engineering Fair (ISEF)
description: The world's largest pre-college science competition. Winners receive significant recognition from top universities and often get direct recruitment. Demonstrates exceptional research ability and scientific thinking.
timeCommitment: 12-18 months of intensive research and preparation

name: USA Biology Olympiad (USABO)
description: National team selection leads to international competition. Top performers often receive full scholarships to elite universities. Shows mastery of advanced biological concepts.
timeCommitment: 2-3 years of preparation, 6-8 hours per week

name: Start a Nonprofit Organization
description: Founding and successfully running a nonprofit demonstrates leadership, social impact, and organizational skills. Shows initiative and ability to create meaningful change.

name: Simons Research Program
description: Prestigious summer research program at Stony Brook University. Participants work with PhD mentors on cutting-edge research. High publication rate and strong college placement.

name: Scholastic Art & Writing Awards
description: National competition recognizing outstanding creative work. Gold Medal winners often receive college scholarships and recognition from admissions officers.

name: USA Computing Olympiad (USACO)
description: Premier programming competition leading to national team selection. Platinum level achievement is highly valued by top CS programs and tech companies.
timeCommitment: 2-3 years of practice, 8-12 hours per week

name: Congressional App Challenge
description: Nationwide competition where students create apps addressing local issues. Winners are recognized by Congress and often receive congressional internships.
timeCommitment: 3-6 months to develop and submit app

name: United World Colleges (UWC)
description: International education program promoting cross-cultural understanding. Graduates have exceptional college placement rates and strong global networks.

name: American Mathematics Competitions (AMC/AIME/USAMO)
description: Progression through AMC 10/12, AIME, and USAMO demonstrates exceptional mathematical ability. USAMO qualification is highly prestigious for STEM programs.
timeCommitment: 2-4 years of preparation, 5-10 hours per week

name: DECA International Competition
description: Premier business competition with international recognition. Top performers often receive business school scholarships and internship opportunities.
timeCommitment: 1-2 years, 6-8 hours per week during season

name: National YoungArts Foundation
description: Prestigious arts competition providing mentorship and performance opportunities. Winners often receive full scholarships to top arts programs.

name: Harvard Model United Nations
description: Premier international Model UN conference. Best delegate awards demonstrate exceptional public speaking, negotiation, and international relations knowledge.

name: Health Occupations Students of America (HOSA)
description: National competition in health sciences. Winners demonstrate readiness for medical careers and often receive recognition from medical schools.

name: Presidential Volunteer Service Award
description: Federal recognition for outstanding community service. Gold level (250+ hours) demonstrates sustained commitment to service and leadership.

name: National Spanish Examinations
description: National language proficiency competition. Gold medal winners demonstrate exceptional language skills valued by international programs.

name: Invention Convention Worldwide
description: Global invention competition encouraging innovation and entrepreneurship. Winners often receive patent support and recognition from engineering schools.

name: Tournament of Champions (TOC) Debate
description: Premier high school debate tournament. Qualification demonstrates elite-level argumentation and public speaking skills highly valued by top universities.

name: Google Science Fair
description: Global online science competition for students. Winners receive mentorship from Google scientists and significant scholarship opportunities.

name: Start and Lead a School Publication
description: Creating and leading a school newspaper, magazine, or digital publication demonstrates leadership, writing skills, and media literacy.

name: Congressional Youth Cabinet
description: Selective program where students work directly with members of Congress on policy issues. Provides unique government experience and networking.

name: Create STEM Education Program
description: Developing and implementing STEM education programs for younger students demonstrates teaching ability, subject mastery, and commitment to education.

name: Hospital Teen Advisory Board
description: Serve on a youth board advising hospital leadership on teen health initiatives.

name: Public Health Infographic Series
description: Design a weekly health awareness infographic series for school and social media.

name: Blood Drive Coordinator
description: Partner with Red Cross to organize annual blood donation drives.

name: Youth Bioethics Book Club
description: Lead discussions on medical ethics through popular science and bioethics texts.

name: Medical Spanish Study Group
description: Learn medical Spanish to better communicate in clinical settings.

name: Financial Literacy Workshops for Teens
description: Host peer-led workshops on budgeting, investing, and credit basics.

name: E‑Commerce Product Launch
description: Design and sell a product using an online marketplace like Etsy or Shopify.

name: Local Business Spotlight Blog
description: Interview small business owners and write blog posts about their journey.

name: Student Investment Fund
description: Start a mock investment group where students track and pitch real stocks.

name: Gen Z Business Trends Podcast
description: Produce a podcast discussing new business trends popular among teens.

name: Reverse Engineering Project
description: Disassemble a common household device and explain its engineering components.

name: Bridge Building Competition
description: Participate in structural design contests using balsa wood or software modeling.

name: 3D Printing for Good
description: Design and print tools, prosthetics, or educational models for your community.

name: Intro to CAD Workshops
description: Teach basic CAD skills (e.g., Fusion 360) to other students.

name: Renewable Energy Model
description: Build a small wind or solar-powered device to demonstrate green tech.

name: Mock Trial Club
description: Simulate real court cases and compete in regional mock trial tournaments.

name: Youth Justice Blog
description: Write articles on criminal justice reform and youth policy topics.

name: Court Observation Project
description: Attend public court sessions and reflect on proceedings in a journal.

name: Civic Action Campaign
description: Organize a campaign around a local issue to influence policy or awareness.

name: Legal Aid Volunteer
description: Support local legal aid clinics with outreach, translation, or admin tasks.

name: Python Bootcamp for Middle Schoolers
description: Create a beginner‑friendly curriculum and teach Python to younger students.

name: Open Source Contribution
description: Contribute to a GitHub open‑source project or start your own.

name: AI Chatbot Development
description: Build a chatbot that answers questions for a specific topic (e.g., school club FAQ).

name: Cybersecurity Workshop Series
description: Teach students how to stay safe online with basic cybersecurity tips.

name: Digital Art Generator with Code
description: Code a generative art tool using JavaScript or Python (e.g., Turtle, p5.js).

name: Mental Health Needs Assessment
description: Design and analyze a student survey in collaboration with school counselors to identify unmet mental health needs. Use results to recommend new support systems or programming.

name: Nonprofit Impact Metrics Program
description: Help a local nonprofit develop metrics and simple analysis methods to evaluate their program outcomes and share that data with donors or stakeholders.

name: Myth-Busting with Local Data
description: Pick a widely held misconception (like 'teens are always on their phones') and collect local data to statistically test and communicate the truth through infographics or a zine.

name: Sports Analytics for School Teams
description: Analyze your school's team data (e.g., basketball shot charts, running splits) to identify trends and provide strategy reports to coaches.

name: Math Fair Probability Booth
description: Create interactive games or demos to teach students about probability and statistics at a school math fair.
